Description: Ostracon, fragment of the lower-body of a buff-coloured pottery shallow bowl (?), both the interior and the exterior, the latter of which is slightly grooved, are covered with a burnished yellow slip, the interior bears traces of four lines of Coptic text written in black ink.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (394645) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/394645)
